intro: Carex capillaris subsp. porsildiana, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tundra or mountainous habitats. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to form dense colonies in its native environment.
